ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend the class to another student.

AFAM 650 is a class that explores African American literature in the 20th century, including poetry, drama, and a great deal of secondary reading. I would recommend this class to another student because I enjoyed it and it is a great introduction to modern African American literature.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course certainly helped my understanding of the 20th century literary scene among these authors, which was one of my goals in taking the course.
This class deepened my knowledge of contemporary criticism of Afro-Modernist literature to a tremendous degree, raising important methodological questions and pointing toward further research.
My research is in modern African American literature, so it was very useful to me as it exposed me to different authors and texts that I had not read before.
